conclusion: Analyzing the velocity-time graphs for both cars to determine if their displacements are the same during the time period from t=0 to t=t₁.
The vertical axis represents velocity (v) and the horizontal axis represents time (t).
Car A's velocity starts at v₁ and increases to v₂ (curve labeled A).
Car B's velocity starts at v₂ and decreases to v₁ (curve labeled B).
Both cars are traveling in the same direction on a straight highway.
The displacement of each car equals the area under its velocity-time curve.

premise: The displacement of each car equals the area under its velocity-time curve.

conclusion: Car A starts with velocity v₁ at t=0 and ends with velocity v₂ at t=t₁.

premise: Car A starts with velocity v₁ at t=0 and ends with velocity v₂ at t=t₁.
conclusion: The displacement of Car A equals the area under curve A from t=0 to t=t₁.
Car B starts with velocity v₂ at t=0 and ends with velocity v₁ at t=t₁.

premise: Car B starts with velocity v₂ at t=0 and ends with velocity v₁ at t=t₁.
conclusion: The displacement of Car B equals the area under curve B from t=0 to t=t₁.
The total area of the rectangle bounded by v=0, v=v₂, t=0, and t=t₁ is v₂·t₁.

premise: The total area of the rectangle bounded by v=0, v=v₂, t=0, and t=t₁ is v₂·t₁.
conclusion: Both curves (A and B) together fill this rectangle.

premise: Both curves (A and B) together fill this rectangle.
conclusion: The area under curve A plus the area under curve B equals v₂·t₁.

premise: Car A starts with velocity v₁ at t=0 and ends with velocity v₂ at t=t₁. Car B starts with velocity v₂ at t=0 and ends with velocity v₁ at t=t₁.
conclusion: The average velocity of Car A is (v₁ + v₂)/2 and the average velocity of Car B is (v₂ + v₁)/2.
